title: Unauthenticated arbitrary file upload on the https://█████/ (█████████)
content:
Description
I was able to identify unsafe upload endpoint on the https://█████/upload.php
POC
1) Go to the https://█████████/upload.php
2) Upload some test file.
You will see success message:
████
3) Visit https://███/delete.me and you will see your uploaded file there
I uploaded example test file with string test file
█████████
Impact
Arbitrary file upload, may lead to the Stored XSS, hosting attacker's content and code execution.
steps: Upload a test file and note the success message
Visit https://███/delete.me to see the uploaded file
vuln_description: Unauthenticated arbitrary file upload vulnerability on the target website, allowing attackers to upload files without authentication. This can lead to stored XSS, hosting malicious content, or even remote code execution.
reason: The vulnerability is straightforward to discover as it involves a simple unauthenticated file upload endpoint with no apparent restrictions or complex interactions. The steps to reproduce are minimal and do not require advanced knowledge or manipulation of application states.
